required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Angiotensin II Pathway and Acute Lung Injury
clinical_study.official_title: The Mechanism Research of Angiotensin II Pathway and Acute Lung Injury

brief_summary.textblock: Acute type A aortic dissection is often accompanied by postoperative pulmonary complications, the cause of which is not fully understood.Angiotensin II is an important component of the renin-angiotensin system (RAS), which has been suggested to be involved in the development of aortic dissection and pulmonary inflammation.The purpose of this study was to investigate the role and mechanism of angiotensin II pathway in postoperative pulmonary complications after acute type A aortic dissection, and to provide reference for clinical application

primary_outcome.measure: The difference of Ang II and ACE2 in serum between patients with and without postoperative pulmonary complications.
primary_outcome.description: Blood samples were taken within 24 hours after operation to detect the contents of Ang II and ACE2 in serum.

secondary_outcome.measure: The number and types of postoperative pulmonary complications.
secondary_outcome.description: It refers to various postoperative respiratory complications, mainly including pulmonary infection, respiratory failure, pleural effusion, lung collapse, pneumothorax, bronchospasm, aspiration pneumonia, pulmonary edema, acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS), etc.

It refers to various postoperative respiratory complications, mainly including pulmonary infection, respiratory failure, pleural effusion, lung collapse, Hours of Hours of mechanical ventilation after surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Stay in the Intensive Care Unit
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of Stay in the intensive care unit after surgery

arm_group.arm_group_label: The group with postoperative pulmonary complications
The group without postoperative pulmonary complications

intervention.arm_group_label: The group with postoperative pulmonary complications
The group without postoperative pulmonary complications

study_pop.textblock: Patients undergoing surgical treatment for acute type A aortic dissection in our hospital were selected. The age was 18 years ≤ age ≤80years, and gender was not limited. According to the occurrence of postoperative pulmonary complications, the patients were divided into postoperative pulmonary complications group and Non-postoperative pulmonary complications group

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients undergoing surgery for acute type A aortic dissection
- age between 18 to 80
Exclusion Criteria:
- Cardiac function and respiratory function were seriously impaired before surgery

responsible_party.investigator_title: The chief of department of anesthesiology
